results.title: Trial at Nuremberg. Facing judgement.
results.brief_description: This video documents the trial of 21 German war criminals at Nuremberg over a period of 217 days from November 1945-1946. This film describes the events at the end of the Second World war leading up to the trials. “Facing judgement” is a Movietone newsreel following the trial of Adolph Eichmann in Israel in 1961 for crimes committed during the Second World War.

results.title: Trial at Nuremberg
results.creator_credit: Columbia Broadcasting System, CBS News and Burton Benjamin
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Twentieth century”
Narrated by Walter Cronkite, this newsreel film shows parts of the trials at Nuremberg between October 1945 and August 1946. During the trials some Russian made film of German atrocities was shown. This is included as is also film giving the background to the trial.

results.title: Trial 1001
results.creator_credit: Granada Television International and David Boulton
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “World in action”
Trade unions are illegal in Spain. A meeting had been arranged in a monastery, but ten men were brutally arrested as they arrived. Their relations describe the conditions of Franco’s dictatorship and the humiliation the men undergo in fighting for a basic human right.

results.title: Trevor Island
results.brief_description:
The latest adventure from Australia’s ATOM award winning supercat. Trevor’s family move to a tropical island and decide to set up an airport and car park. A sedate lifestyle, however, is not Trevor’s trademark. As usual, Trevor meets this challenge in his own way.
Voices by Richard Healy, Jane Lewis, Danny Nash, David Crosbie and John Taylor.

results.title: Tregatay Tracadie: river through time
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Dennis Sawyer and David McLeod
results.brief_description: A two-year archaeological dig at several sites along the shores of the Tracadie River in New Brunswick unearths artifacts that support an old man’s memories of the days when Indians would camp every summer by the river and weave baskets and that point to the presence of Micmac indians over thousands of years. Archaeologists Micmac explain the nature and function of the ceramic pieces and stone implements. This film jolts its audience into the realization that history is all around us, and not something that exists only in distant lands. Voice and Narration: David Keenlyside, Judy Keenlyside
results.creator_credit_for_label: ONF | NFB, Dennis Sawyer and David McLeod

results.title: Treffpunkt Deutschland. Episodes 1-5
results.creator_credit: BBC, John Billingham and John Thomas
results.brief_description: A compilation tape of five programmes designed to help students in their second or third year of learning German. The programmes are built around everyday experiences of some German teenagers and are entirely in German. A simple linking commentary repeats and reinforces the most useful language used. Individual titles indicate content of each program.

results.title: Trees to tame the wind
results.brief_description: In this film we are introduced to a farmer and his son who, in 1934, were distressed by the damage wrought by drought and wind to their farm. At the suggestion of the Forest Service Officer, the farmer decided to carry out a Forest Service plan for planting trees to act as wind-breaks and shelter-belts on his farm, as part of the Prairie States Forestry Project “The Shelterbelt” which extended from North Dakota to Texas. By 1939, this kind of tree planting was being encouraged all over the prairie farmlands in the United States with participation by the farmers an essential part of the program.

results.title: Trees for the wheatlands
results.creator_credit: Western Australian Government Film Unit and Norman A. Uren
results.brief_description: The importance of trees for shade and shelter, beautification, and control of wind erosion in certain areas of the wheatbelt. The Forests Department of Western Australia renders valuable service to farmers and others who desire to plant trees on their properties.
